summary: Valentine’s Day themed multi-page website with romantic messages and photo galleries across 5 pages (new final page: "this is where it all started").
architectural_notes: Website will have 5 pages with Valentine’s Day themed color scheme and text/photo content per page.
Implement animated page transition overlay (butterflies + hearts) triggered on navigation between the 5 pages.

existing_features.title: Create a 4-page Valentine’s Day themed website with consistent romantic styling (colors, typography, layout) across all pages.
Implement Page 1 (landing page) with the exact long message provided by the user and display the 1st and 4th uploaded images: IMG_20260123_022920_162.jpg and IMG_20260123_022853_008.jpg.

Implement Page 2 with the heading text exactly: "some of the countless memories that we had in the last 8 months" and show a gallery of additional uploaded photos (excluding the two used on Page 1 and excluding the photos reserved for Page 4). Use these images on Page 2: IMG_20260110_001106_333.jpg, IMG_20260123_022956_194.jpg, IMG_20260123_022822_917.jpg, IMG_20260123_023006_342.jpg.

Implement Page 3 with a flower photo and the text exactly: " I will always have all the gift that u gave Mee in my heart ". Use a generated flower image asset (see Image Requirements) for the flower photo.

Implement Page 4 as a gallery containing the remaining uploaded photos (all uploaded images not shown on Pages 1 and 2): IMG_20260123_022914_736.jpg, IMG_20260123_022814_325.jpg, IMG_20260123_022756_879.jpg, IMG_20260118_135409_239.jpg, IMG_20260123_022932_300.jpg.
Add simple navigation between the 4 pages (e.g., top nav and/or next/previous buttons) so the site can be viewed sequentially on mobile and desktop.
Add all uploaded images to the frontend as static assets and reference them by filename in the pages specified above (do not serve images through the backend).

Render the generated images listed in Image Requirements from frontend static assets (frontend/public/assets/generated) and use them in the UI (background/fallback visuals) consistently with the theme.

Add a page-to-page transition animation that plays on every navigation between the 4 routes (via the top nav and the bottom sequential pager). The transition must display a full-screen overlay filled with animated hearts and butterflies, then reveal the destination page after the animation completes.
Implement the transition overlay in a reusable way within the shared routed layout so it applies consistently across all pages without duplicating logic in each page component.
Add a new final (last) route/page to the site and display the text exactly: "this is where it all started".
Update the router and all navigation controls so the new final page is included in: (1) the top navigation, and (2) the bottom sequential pager order, with the new page being the last step.
On the new final page, include a simple responsive gallery (or equivalent visual presentation) that displays the newly uploaded PNG images so the user can confirm the pictures are visible.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine’s Day themed multi-page website (4 pages) with specified messages and photo placement per page.
Add page-to-page transition animation showing a full-screen overlay filled with butterflies and hearts when navigating between pages.
Add a new 5th (last) page that displays the text exactly: "this is where it all started".

Add the newly uploaded images as frontend static assets under frontend/public/assets/uploads and (at minimum) ensure they can be referenced by filename from the frontend code without using the backend: 1771025953219.png, 1771025927131.png, 1771025946100.png, 1771025953219-1.png, 1771025946100-1.png, 1771025953219-2.png, 1771025946100-2.png, 1771025927131-1.png, 1771025927131-2.png, 1771025145088.png, 1771025145088-1.png.

projectName: Valentine’s Day 4-page website with themed design and photo galleries
